review: The Amazon Fire TV Stick, met and surpassed our expectations.  We received the Fire Stick as a gift at Christmas, we just set a couple of settings plugged it in a PRESTO, connections to our PRIME TV, Video and music, plus Netflix, HULU, games and more.  Add to that, the Fire TV App for our Android phones (pretty sure there is an Apple one as well) and know we can view our phone pix and video, as well!  Just perfect.
author: Patrick Brown

review: I actually love this device and how easy it makes viewing Amazon Prime, Youtube, etc. It was super easy to set up and works very well.  My only complaint is the remote has a battery compartment that is very difficult to open and not sure about the overall quality of the remote.
author: Michael M. Murders "Rzrbacker"

review: Maybe it is s mater of unrealistic expectations, but I found little real info on this item before buying it. I expected my computer based programs (Hulu for example) to be channeled to my TV. They are not.  Most if not all items require a  subscription and if the App isn't one that fire has enrolled you are out of luck. That said,  it does what it does well. Instructions for use are non-existent as with so much these days, but I got it figured out.
author: Ken Gruber

review: LOVE it !  Works great. Would recommend it!

review: The Fire Stick is great for the price. It has everything I need to watch a multitude of movies with a remote control.  It has Netflix and of course Amazon.  It is great to be able to watch my Amazon movies and even my purchased movies in my cloud. I would differently recommend the Fire Stick.

review: It's a snap to configure. However there are drawbacks that aren't mentioned. First this requires a separate power supply. I have my TV mounted on a wall and the power supply is too big to cleanly fit between the wall and the TV. Also I'm a Comcast customer and cannot use my Comcast login to view Showtime to go.
